p:
The four structural proteins of SARS-CoV-2 include the spike surface glycoprotein (S), small envelope protein (E), matrix protein (M), and nucleocapsid protein (N). In coronaviruses, the S gene codes for the receptor-binding spike protein that enables the virus to infect cells.
18 This spike protein mediates receptor binding and membrane fusion, which determines host tropism and transmission capabilities.
4 In SARS-CoV-2, the S gene is divergent with <75% nucleotide sequence similarity when compared to all previously described SARS-related coronaviruses.
1 The other three structural proteins are more conserved than the spike protein and are necessary for general coronavirus function.
15 These proteins are involved in encasing the RNA and/or in protein assembly, budding, envelope formation, and pathogenesis.
